Advice: Attendre que le feu soit vert
Sentence: It’s safer to wait for the green light—it’s designed to protect you, not just to look nice.

Advice: Avoir peur de traverser un grand carrefour
Sentence: Take your time and cross when the flow of people and traffic lines up.

Advice: Choisir un trottoir ombragé
Sentence: If you can, walk in the shade—it makes the journey easier and helps you keep your energy.

Advice: Ne pas bloquer le passage
Sentence: Just a small step to the side can let others pass more easily—everyone benefits from a clear path.

Advice: Ne pas traverser en diagonale
Sentence: Crossing in a straight line at the crosswalk helps everyone see you more clearly and keeps you safer.

Advice: Regarder des deux côtés avant de traverser
Sentence: Always look both ways before crossing—even on a one-way street. It’s safer.

Advice: Rester sur le trottoir
Sentence: Stay on the sidewalk whenever possible—it’s safer and helps you build good walking habits.

Advice: Savoir attendre au feu piéton
Sentence: Cross only when the signal is green—that’s when drivers expect people to cross and it’s safest for you.

Advice: Traverser sur les passages piétons
Sentence: Use the crosswalk each time—drivers and cyclists are prepared for you there.

Advice: Avoir trop chaud ou froid pour marcher bien
Sentence: You’ll feel better if you cross into the shade; it helps you avoid getting too hot, even if it takes a little longer.

Advice: Ne pas courir sur la route
Sentence: Don’t run into the street—even if it seems empty. Roads are not playgrounds and cars can appear quickly.

Advice: Regarder où l’on met les pieds
Sentence: Watch where you step as well as where you’re headed—the ground can be uneven.

Advice: Voir et être vu (visibilité, vêtements clairs)
Sentence: It’s important to be visible when you share the road—wearing bright colors helps keep everyone safe.

Advice: Savoir quand faire demi-tour
Sentence: If you turn back now, you’ll avoid getting stuck between the delivery vans.

Advice: Éviter de marcher trop lentement en groupe
Sentence: It helps everyone if we keep up with the pace of the city.

Advice: Éviter les écouteurs à plein volume
Sentence: It’s safer to keep one ear open when walking outside, so you can notice what’s happening around you.

Advice: Être pressé mais devoir ralentir
Sentence: Moving too fast can make things less safe.

Advice: Lire une carte ou un plan de métro
Sentence: South is over there—if you want to reach downtown, stay on the right. That marker can be confusing.

Advice: Prendre un chemin connu quand on est perdu
Sentence: If you’re lost, go back to a familiar spot—it’s the best way to find your direction again.

Advice: Se repérer avec des repères visuels
Sentence: See that statue? It lines up with the main entrance, so north is to your right.

Advice: Se fier aux repères visuels
Sentence: Align yourself with the pole rather than the paint—that’s the correct reference.

Advice: Faire attention aux sorties de parking
Sentence: Always look at gaps in buildings or fences—parking exits can open unexpectedly.

Advice: Faire attention aux vélos et trottinettes
Sentence: Stay within the marked stripes—outside them, you may be in an area meant for wheels, not pedestrians.

Advice: Interpréter un panneau mal placé
Sentence: That sign is misleading—use the railings to find the side entrance. It wasn’t updated after the construction.

Advice: Laisser passer les personnes âgées
Sentence: Let older people cross first—they may move more slowly, and it’s safer for everyone.

Advice: Ne pas jeter ses déchets par terre
Sentence: If you can’t find a bin, just keep your wrapper in your pocket—it helps keep public spaces pleasant.

Advice: Oser faire demi-tour si on s’est trompé
Sentence: Let’s turn back before we get too far off track.

Advice: Respecter l’espace personnel
Sentence: Give others space, even if you’re in a hurry—it helps everyone move around more easily.

Advice: Se retrouver bloqué par une foule dense
Sentence: If the crowd is too dense, moving to the side can help keep things flowing.

Advice: Se souvenir d’un chemin pour le refaire
Sentence: You turned left last time, and it worked well then.

Advice: Suivre les panneaux de direction
Sentence: Sometimes, the best places are hidden. That sign is the right one—just follow where it points.

Advice: Trouver une rue en demandant son chemin
Sentence: You missed a turn—go back, then take a left at the bakery.

Advice: Être distrait par une vitrine ou un bruit
Sentence: Bright displays can distract us from where we’re going.

Advice: Être ébloui par le soleil ou gêné par le vent
Sentence: Staying close to the edge until the light softens will help you walk more comfortably.

Advice: Être émerveillé par une scène inattendue
Sentence: Some things can’t be found on a map—they’re meant to be discovered.

Advice: Se rendre compte des gestes utiles à faire
Sentence: Offering a hand at the right moment can make a real difference.
